bibl.title: Telegram from Joseph A. LePrince to Laura Armistead Carter, September 15, 1925

div1.p: LePrince sends his condolences upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Telegram from Joseph A. LePrince to Laura Armistead Carter, September 15, 1925
div1.opener:
WESTERN UNION
WESTERN UNION
TELEGRAM
NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT
GEORGE W. E. ATKINS, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
The filing time as shown in the date line on full rate telegrams and day letters, and the time of receipt at destination as shown on all messages, is STANDARD TIME.
Received at Commercial Nat'l Bank Bldg., 14th & G. Sts., N. W. Washington. D. C.
ALWAYS
OPEN
CFC5 35 NL
1925 SEP 15 AM 2 39
ASHEVILLE NCAR 14
185
MISS LAURA CARTER CARE MRS W C GORGAS THE HIGHLANDS WASHINGTON DC
div1.p:
I HAVE JUST HEARD THAT THE END HAS COME AND SEND MY SINCERE
SYMPATHY PERIOD THERE NEVER HAS BEEN A BRAVER TRUER OR BETTER
MAN IF I CAN BE OF ANY ASSISTANCE LET ME KNOW
